type.comment: Can be one of the following: 'inbound', 'outbound'

remote_subdomain.comment: Subdomain of the remote account or null if not associated with an account

created_at.comment: The time the record was created

partner_name.comment: Can be one of the following: 'jira', null

status.comment: Can be one of the following: 'accepted', 'declined', 'pending', 'inactive'

updated_at.comment: The time the identity got updated

created_at.comment: The time the identity got created

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

created_at.comment: When this record was created

default_locale_id.comment: The default locale for the item. Must be one of the locales the account has active.

name.comment: The unique name of the item

placeholder.comment: Automatically generated placeholder for the item, derived from name

outdated.comment: Indicates the item has outdated variants within it

url.comment: The API url of this item

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the membership

created_at.comment: The time the membership was created

default.comment: If true, tickets assigned directly to the agent will assume this membership's group.

url.comment: The API url of this record

created_at.comment: The time the identity got created

updated_at.comment: The time the identity got updated
Time the schedule was last updated

created_at.comment: Time the schedule was created

intervals.comment: Array of intervals for the schedule

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the handle

avatar_url.comment: The profile image url of the handle

created_at.comment: The time the handle was created

name.comment: The profile name of the handle

allow_reply.comment: If replies are allowed for this handle

active.comment: If the form is set as active

restricted_organization_ids.comment: ids of all organizations that this ticket form is restricted to

display_name.comment: The name of the form that is displayed to an end user

in_all_organizations.comment: Is the form available for use in all organizations on this account

end_user_visible.comment: Is the form visible to the end user

position.comment: The position of this form among other forms in the account, i.e. dropdown

raw_name.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "name" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

raw_display_name.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "display_name" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

ticket_field_ids.comment: ids of all ticket fields which are in this ticket form

default.comment: Is the form the default form for this account

in_all_brands.comment: Is the form available for use in all brands on this account

restricted_brand_ids.comment: ids of all brands that this ticket form is restricted to

content_url.comment: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded

size.comment: The size of the image file in bytes

file_name.comment: The name of the image file

thumbnails.comment: An array of Photo objects. Note that thumbnails do not have thumbnails.

inline.comment: If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

content_type.comment: The content type of the image. Example value: image/png

problem_id.comment: The problem this incident is linked to, if any

satisfaction_rating.comment: The satisfaction rating of the ticket, if it exists, or the state of satisfaction, 'offered' or 'unoffered'

description.comment: The first comment on the ticket

url.comment: The API url of this ticket

forum_topic_id.comment: The topic this ticket originated from, if any

allow_channelback.comment: Is false if channelback is disabled, true otherwise - only applicable for channels framework ticket

due_at.comment: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date.  Due date format uses ISO 8601 format.

group_id.comment: The group this ticket is assigned to

followup_ids.comment: The ids of the followups created from this ticket - only applicable for closed tickets

brand_id.comment: The id of the brand this ticket is associated with - only applicable for enterprise accounts

assignee_id.comment: What agent is currently assigned to the ticket

recipient.comment: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket

type.comment: The type of this ticket, i.e. "problem", "incident", "question" or "task"

is_public.comment: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

priority.comment: Priority, defines the urgency with which the ticket should be addressed: "urgent", "high", "normal", "low"

has_incidents.comment: Is true of this ticket has been marked as a problem, false otherwise

created_at.comment: When this record was created

custom_fields.comment: The custom fields of the ticket

raw_subject.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

sharing_agreement_ids.comment: The ids of the sharing agreements used for this ticket

tags.comment: The array of tags applied to this ticket

submitter_id.comment: The user who submitted the ticket; The submitter always becomes the author of the first comment on the ticket.

requester_id.comment: The user who requested this ticket

organization_id.comment: The organization of the requester. *Writable only when creating, not when updating

external_id.comment: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

ticket_form_id.comment: The id of the ticket form to render for this ticket - only applicable for enterprise accounts

via.comment: This object explains how the ticket was created

subject.comment: The value of the subject field for this ticket

collaborator_ids.comment: Who are currently CC'ed on the ticket

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

user.comment: The user this activity pertains to

target.comment: The target of this activity, a ticket.

verb.comment: The type of activity. Can be tickets.assignment, tickets.comment, or  tickets.priority_increase

created_at.comment: When this record was created

object.comment: The content of this activity. Can be a ticket, comment, or change.

url.comment: The API url of this activity

actor.comment: The actor causing the creation of the activity

via.comment: How the comment was created. See Via Object

created_at.comment: The time the comment was created

plain_body.comment: The comment formatted as plain text

public.comment: true if a public comment; false if an internal note

metadata.comment: System information (web client, IP address, etc.)

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the comment is created

author_id.comment: The id of the comment author

last_seen_at.comment: The last approximate time this session was seen. This does not update on every request.

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the session is created

url.comment: The API URL of this session

created_at.comment: The time the organization was created

details.comment: Any details obout the organization, such as the address

external_id.comment: A unique external id to associate organizations to an external record

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the organization is created

group_id.comment: New tickets from users in this organization are automatically put in this group

shared_tickets.comment: End users in this organization are able to see each other's tickets

domain_names.comment: An array of domain names associated with this organization

url.comment: The API url of this organization

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the organization

shared_comments.comment: End users in this organization are able to see each other's comments on tickets

notes.comment: Any notes you have about the organization

name.comment: A unique name for the organization

created_at.comment: The time the token was created

used_at.comment: The latest time this token was used for authentication

expires_at.comment: The time the token will expiry

client_id.comment: The id of the client this token belongs to

user_id.comment: The id of the user this token authenticates as

url.comment: The API url of this record

scopes.comment: An array of the valid scopes for this token. See Scopes below

position.comment: Position of the trigger, determines the order they will execute in

created_at.comment: The time the trigger was created

actions.comment: An object describing what the trigger will do

conditions.comment: An object that describes the conditions under which the trigger will execute

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the trigger

type.comment: A pre-defined target, such as "basecamp_target". See the additional attributes for the type that follow

created_at.comment: The time the target was created

active.comment: Whether or not the target is activated

type.comment: Type of the custom field: "checkbox", "date", "decimal", "dropdown", "integer", "regexp", "text", or "textarea"

system.comment: If true, only active and position values of this field can be changed

created_at.comment: The time the ticket field was created

raw_title.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

regexp_for_validation.comment: Regular expression field only. The validation pattern for a field value to be deemed valid.

title.comment: The title of the custom field

raw_description.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "description" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

description.comment: User-defined description of this field's purpose

url.comment: The URL for this resource

position.comment: Ordering of the field relative to other fields

active.comment: If true, this field is available for use

custom_field_options.comment: Required and presented for a custom field of type "dropdown"

tag.comment: Optional for custom field of type "checkbox"; not presented otherwise.

key.comment: A unique key that identifies this custom field. This is used for updating the field and referencing in placeholders.

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the ticket field

request_id.comments: A unique identifier for the push request

instance_push_id.comments: The ID of the account to which data will be pushed.  This was passed to the integration service when the administrator set up the account.

ticket_id.comment: The ID of the associated ticket

created_at.comment: The time the audit was created

via.comment: This object explains how this audit was created

author_id.comment: The user who created the audit

events.comment: An array of the events that happened in this audit. See Audit Events

metadata.comment: Metadata for the audit, custom and system data

favicon_url.comment: The URL for the custom favicon

page_background_color.comment: HEX of the page background color

text_color.comment: HEX of the text color, usually matched to contrast well with header_color

header_logo_url.comment: The URL for the custom header logo

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the group

created_at.comment: The time the group was created

deleted.comment: Deleted groups get marked as such

updated_at.comment: Time the skip was last updated

message_id.comment: The ID of the email, if available

brand_id.comment: The id of the brand this ticket is associated with - only applicable for enterprise accounts

ticket_id.comment: The ticket ID this suspended email is associated with, if available

author.comment: The author id (if available), name and email

ticket_form_ids.comment: The ids of ticket forms that are available for use by a brand

has_help_center.comment: If the brand has a Help Center

host_mapping.comment: The hostmapping to this brand, if any (only admins view this key)

signature_template.comment: The signature template for a brand

default.comment: Is the brand the default brand for this account

global.comment: Whether this client is globally accessible. Learn more

created_at.comment: The time the client was created

redirect_uri.comment: An array of the valid redirect URIs for this client

description.comment: A short description of your client that is displayed to users when they are considering approving access to your application.

secret.comment: The client secret. Generated automatically on creation and returned in full only at that time.

identifier.comment: The unique identifier for this client

logo_url.comment: The API logo url of this record

user_id.comment: The id of the admin who created the client

company.comment: Choose a company name to display when users are asked to approve access to your application. The name will help users understand who they are granting access to.

created_at.comment: The time the automation was created

actions.comment: An object describing what the automation will do

conditions.comment: An object that describes the conditions under which the automation will execute

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the automation

active.comment: Useful for determining if the view should be displayed

execution.comment: An object describing how the view should be executed

sla_id.comment: If the view is for an SLA, shows the id

conditions.comment: An object describing how the view is constructed

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the view

restriction.comment: Who may access this account. Will be null when everyone in the account can access it.

system.comment: If true, only active and position values of this field can be changed

created_at.comment: The time the ticket field was created

raw_title.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

regexp_for_validation.comment: Regular expression field only. The validation pattern for a field value to be deemed valid.

title.comment: The title of the custom field

raw_description.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "description" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

description.comment: User-defined description of this field's purpose

url.comment: The URL for this resource

position.comment: Ordering of the field relative to other fields

active.comment: If true, this field is available for use

custom_field_options.comment: Required and presented for a custom field of type "dropdown"

tag.comment: Optional for custom field of type "checkbox"; not presented otherwise.

key.comment: A unique key that identifies this custom field. This is used for updating the field and referencing in placeholders.

email.comment: The primary email address of this user

created_at.comment: The time the user was created

photo.comment: The user's profile picture represented as an Attachment object

url.comment: The API url of this user

organization_id.comment: The id of the organization this user is associated with

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the user

locale_id.comment: The language identifier for this user

verified.comment: Zendesk Support has verified that this user is who he says he is

phone.comment: The primary phone number of this user. See Phone Number above

role.comment: The role of the user. Possible values: "end-user", "agent", "admin"

orderable.comment: True if reordering has any effect

custom_role_id.comment: A custom role if the user is an agent on the Enterprise plan

shared.comment: If the user is shared from a different Zendesk Support instance. Ticket sharing accounts only

tags.comment: The user's tags. Only present if your account has user tagging enabled

time_zone.comment: The user's time zone. See Time Zone below

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the user is created

signature.comment: The user's signature. Only agents and admins can have signatures

url.comment: The user's API url

restricted_agent.comment: If the agent has any restrictions; false for admins and unrestricted agents, true for other agents

ticket_restriction.comment: Specifies which tickets the user has access to. Possible values are: "organization", "groups", "assigned", "requested", null

active.comment: false if the user has been deleted

suspended.comment: If the agent is suspended. Tickets from suspended users are also suspended, and these users cannot sign in to the end user portal

phone.comment: The user's primary phone number. See Phone Number below

notes.comment: Any notes you want to store about the user

chat_only.comment: Whether or not the user is a chat-only agent

two_factor_auth_enabled.comment: If two factor authentication is enabled.

shared_agent.comment: If the user is a shared agent from a different Zendesk Support instance. Ticket sharing accounts only

created_at.comment: The time the user was created

alias.comment: An alias displayed to end users

details.comment: Any details you want to store about the user, such as an address

last_login_at.comment: The last time the user signed in to Zendesk Support

external_id.comment: A unique id you can specify for the user

moderator.comment: Designates whether the user has forum moderation capabilities

photo.comment: The user's profile picture represented as an Attachment object

organization_id.comment: The id of the organization the user is associated with

updated_at.comment: The time the user was last updated

only_private_comments.comment: true if the user can only create private comments

verified.comment: If the user's identity has been verified or not

role.comment: The user's role. Possible values are "end-user", "agent", or "admin"

ticket.comment: An object containing the properties of the bookmarked ticket

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the bookmark is created

created_at.comment: The time the bookmark was created

url.comment: The API url of this bookmark

active.comment: Useful for determining if the macro should be displayed

created_at.comment: The time the macro was created

actions.comment: An object describing what the macro will do

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the macro

restriction.comment: Who may access this macro. Will be null when everyone in the account can access it

updated_at.comment: The time the identity was updated

verified.comment: If the identity has been verified

primary.comment: If the identity is the primary identity. *Writable only when creating, not when updating. Use the Make Identify Primary endpoint instead

value.comment: The identifier for this identity, such as an email address

created_at.comment: The time the identity was created

undeliverable_count.comment: The number of times a non-delivery response was received at that address (maximum 50)

url.comment: The API url of this identity

description.comment: The first comment on the request

url.comment: The API url of this request

custom_fields.comment: The fields and entries for this request

due_at.comment: When the task is due (only applies if the request is of type "task")

group_id.comment: The id of the assigned group if the field is visible to end users

assignee_id.comment: The id of the assignee if the field is visible to end users

recipient.comment: The original recipient e-mail address of the request

created_at.comment: When this record was created

followup_source_id.comment: The id of the original ticket if this request is a follow-up ticket

collaborator_ids.comment: Who are currently CC'ed on the ticket

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

ticket_form_id.comment: The numeric id of the ticket form associated with this request if the form is visible to end users - only applicable for enterprise accounts

via.comment: This object explains how the request was created

solved.comment: Whether or not request is solved (an end user can set this if "can_be_solved_by_me", above, is true for that user)

can_be_solved_by_me.comment: If true, end user can mark request as solved.

subject.comment: The value of the subject field for this request if the subject field is visible to end users; a truncated version of the description otherwise

is_public.comment: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

count.comment: The number of results returned for the current request

end_time.comment: The most recent time present in this result set in Unix epoch time; this should be used as the next start_time

next_page.comment: The URL that should be called to get the next set of results

installations.comment: An array of App Installation IDs

created_at.comment: When this record was created

updated_at.comment: When this record was last updated

type.comment: One of the following: activate, pause, fulfill, apply_sla, breach, or update_status. See Metric event types

created_at.comment: When the record was created

metric.comment: One of the following: agent_work_time, pausable_update_time, periodic_update_time, reply_time, requester_wait_time, or resolution_time

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the record is created

updated_at.comment: When the record was last updated

instance_id.comment: The instance of the metric associated with the event. See instance_id

ticket_id.comment: The id of ticket being rated

comment.comment: The comment received with this rating, if available

created_at.comment: The time the satisfaction rating got created

group_id.comment: The id of group assigned to at the time of rating

assignee_id.comment: The id of agent assigned to at the time of rating

updated_at.comment: The time the satisfaction rating got updated

url.comment: The API url of this rating

requester_id.comment: The id of ticket requester submitting the rating

reply_time_in_minutes.comment: Number of minutes to the first reply inside and out of business hours

replies.comment: Total number of times ticket was replied to

assigned_at.comment: When the ticket was last assigned

assignee_stations.comment: Number of assignees this ticket had

created_at.comment: When this record was created

latest_comment_added_at.comment: When the latest comment was added

requester_updated_at.comment: When the requester last updated the ticket

status_updated_at.comment: When the status was last updated

group_stations.comment: Number of groups this ticket passed through

full_resolution_time_in_minutes.comment: Number of minutes to the full resolution inside and out of business hours

initially_assigned_at.comment: When the ticket was initially assigned

url.comment: The API url of this ticket metric

requester_wait_time_in_minutes.comment: Number of minutes the requester spent waiting inside and out of business hours

assignee_updated_at.comment: When the assignee last updated the ticket

first_resolution_time_in_minutes.comment: Number of minutes to the first resolution time inside and out of business hours

reopens.comment: Total number of times the ticket was reopened

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

agent_wait_time_in_minutes.comment: Number of minutes the agent spent waiting inside and out of business hours

retry_in.comment: Number of seconds after which you may re-check status

app_id.comment: The ID of the app created by this job if it exists

total.comment: The total number of tasks this job is batching through

message.comment: Message from the job worker, if any

id.comment: Automatically assigned as job gets enqueued

url.comment: The URL to poll for status updates

progress.comment: Number of tasks that have already been completed

editable_in_portal.comment: Whether this field is editable by end users

title.comment: The title of the ticket field

raw_title_in_portal.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title_in_portal" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

raw_description.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "description" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

description.comment: The description of the purpose of this ticket field, shown to users

url.comment: The URL for this resource

required.comment: If it's required for this field to have a value when updated by agents

position.comment: A relative position for the ticket fields, determines the order of ticket fields on a ticket

tag.comment: A tag value to set for checkbox fields when checked

required_in_portal.comment: If it's required for this field to have a value when updated by end users

type.comment: The type of the ticket field: "checkbox", "date", "decimal", "integer", "regexp", "tagger", "text", or "textarea"

removable.comment: If this field is not a system basic field that must be present for all tickets on the account

created_at.comment: The time the ticket field was created

raw_title.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

system_field_options.comment: Presented for a ticket field of type "tickettype", "priority" or "status"

visible_in_portal.comment: Whether this field is available to end users

custom_field_options.comment: Required and presented for a ticket field of type "tagger"

title_in_portal.comment: The title of the ticket field when shown to end users

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the ticket field

collapsed_for_agents.comment: If this field should be shown to agents by default or be hidden alongside infrequently used fields. Classic interface only

regexp_for_validation.comment: Regular expression field only. The validation pattern for a field value to be deemed valid.

total.comment: The total number of tasks this job is batching through

message.comment: Message from the job worker, if any

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the job is queued

status.comment: The current status. One of the following: "queued", "working", "failed", "completed", "killed"

url.comment: The URL to poll for status updates

progress.comment: Number of tasks that have already been completed
